intro: Hieracium bruchense, commonly known as the Bruchense Hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium bruchense is known for its aggressive growth and can become invasive in certain environments.
